tabData.tagHTML: Tirthankar idols are identified by a unique symbol (Länchhan) engraved at their base. This symbol corresponds to a birthmark on the Tirthankar's right thigh. For example, Bhagawän Mahävir Swämi's idol has a lion symbol. Digambar idols are unadorned with semi-closed eyes, representing a liberated soul. Shvetämbar idols are elegantly adorned, representing a spiritual king.

Time moves in cycles of rising (Utsarpini) and declining (Avasarpini) eras. In the 3rd and 4th Äräs of each half-cycle, 24 souls become Tirthankars in our region (Bharat Kshetra). They are humans who, through intense spiritual purification over many lives, acquire Tirthankar Näm Karma. After attaining omniscience (Keval-jnän), they re-establish the four-fold Jain order (Sädhus, Sädhvis, Shrävaks, Shrävikäs). They are also known as Arihants, Jinas, and Vitarägis.

While 24 Tirthankars appear in our region during specific eras, Tirthankars can exist in other regions of the universe. In the 5 Mahä-videha Kshetras, conditions are always conducive for Tirthankars. Currently, there are 20 living Tirthankars in these regions, including Shri Simandhar Swämi.

tabs.caption: This table lists the 24 Tirthankars along with their symbols and colors. You can sort columns by clicking on the headers and filter by typing in the input fields below the headers.
This table lists the 24 Tirthankars along with their family details and places. You can sort columns by clicking on the headers and filter by typing in the input fields below the headers.

tabData.title: Auspicious Dreams of Tirthankars
tabData.description: These are the dreams seen by the mother of a Tirthankar before their birth, indicating the greatness of the child.

items.content:
Meaning: A big, tall, impetuous elephant with four tusks, whiter than a heap of pearls.
Indication: The child will have an exceptionally high character and will guide the four-fold spiritual order (monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen).

Meaning: A white bull with a majestic hump and sharp horns.
Indication: The child will be a great spiritual teacher, revered by all, including celestial beings.

Meaning: A powerful lion descending from the sky into the mother's mouth.
Indication: The child will be as mighty as a lion, fearless, and capable of establishing the Jain order.

Meaning: The Goddess Lakshmi, seated on a lotus, being bathed by two elephants.
Indication: The child will possess immense wealth of knowledge and spiritual virtues.

Meaning: A beautiful, fragrant garland of various flowers.
Indication: The child will be gentle, popular, and will spread the fragrance of spiritual teachings.

Meaning: A full, radiant moon.
Indication: The child will bring peace and tranquility to the world, alleviating suffering.

Meaning: A brilliant, rising sun.
Indication: The child will dispel the darkness of ignorance and spread the light of knowledge.

Meaning: A grand, fluttering flag.
Indication: The child will be a great leader, establishing the flag of dharma (righteousness) in the world.

Meaning: Two golden urns filled with divine water.
Indication: The child will bring prosperity and auspiciousness to all beings.

Meaning: A vast lake with thousands of blooming lotuses and aquatic animals.
Indication: The son will be beyond worldly attachments and help liberate others from the cycle of birth and death.

Meaning: A milky white ocean with high, moving waves.
Indication: The son will have a serene personality and achieve infinite perception and knowledge (Moksh).

Meaning: A celestial plane with divine music and aroma, decorated with gold and jewels.
Indication: All celestial beings in heaven will respect and honor the son's spiritual teachings.

Meaning: An enormous, radiant heap of precious jewels.
Indication: The son will have infinite virtues and wisdom and will attain the supreme spirit.

Meaning: A fire burning with great intensity but without any smoke.
Indication: The son will reform the religious order, destroy his karma, and attain salvation.

Meaning: A pair of fish.
Indication: The son will be extremely handsome.

Meaning: A lofty throne.
Indication: The son will have a very high spiritual status.

tabData.title: Key Facts about Tirthankars
tabData.description: Test your knowledge about Tirthankars with these flashcards!

cards.front: Who was the first person to attain liberation in this era, according to Shvetämbar tradition?
cards.back: Marudevi Mätä, mother of Tirthankar Rishabhadev.

cards.front: Who was the first person to attain liberation in this era, according to Digambar tradition?

cards.back: Bharat, the eldest son of Tirthankar Rishabhadev and the first Chakravarti king.

cards.front: Which Tirthankar do Shvetämbars believe was a female?
Lord Räm was a contemporary of which Tirthankar?
Tirthankar Neminäth was a cousin of which famous figure?
Which Tirthankar attained omniscience (Keval-jnän) while standing?
Which Tirthankar is associated with the city of Päväpuri?
cards.back: Bhagawän Mahävir Swämi (where he attained Nirväna).

cards.front: How many Tirthankars are there in each half-cycle of time in Bharat Kshetra?
What is the symbol of Bhagawän Pärshvanäth?
What is the symbol of Bhagawän Mahävir Swämi?

questions.question: What is the Länchhan (symbol) of Bhagawän Mahävir Swämi?
What is the color associated with Tirthankar Munisuvrat Swämi?
Who was the father of Tirthankar Rishabhadev?
Where did Tirthankar Väsupujya-Swämi attain Nirväna?
Which dream signifies that the Tirthankar will guide the four-fold spiritual order?
In which Äräs of the time cycle are Tirthankars born in Bharat Kshetra?
What is the Indian name for the dream of a 'Smokeless Fire'?
Who was the mother of Tirthankar Pärshvanäth?
Which Tirthankar has the symbol of a 'Swastik'?
In what year did Bhagawän Mahävirswämi attain Nirväna?
What is the Nirväna place of Tirthankar Neminäth?
Which Tirthankar is associated with the color 'Red'?
Who was the first Chakravarti king of this era?
The dream of a 'Lotus Lake' (Padma Sarovar) indicates the son would be...?
What is the symbol for Tirthankar Mallinäth according to the Shvetämbar tradition?
Who was the father of Tirthankar Mahävirswämi?
Which living Tirthankar is mentioned as currently preaching in Mahä-videha Kshetra?
The dream of a 'Flag' (Dhwajä) indicates the son would...?
options: Carry the banner of the religion
questions.answer: Carry the banner of the religion

questions.question: What is the birth place of Tirthankar Sambhavnäth?
Which Tirthankar's symbol is a 'Conch Shell'?
Who was the mother of Tirthankar Ajitnäth?
The dream of a 'Heap of Jewels' (Ratna Räshi) indicates the son would have...?
What is the Digambar symbol for Tirthankar Shitalnäth?
Which Tirthankar was a cousin of Lord Krishna?
Where did Tirthankar Rishabhadev attain Nirväna?
